decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's plays by using counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Vendilion Clique. The key strategy is to use Stoneforge Mystic to search for equipment such as Sword of Feast and Famine and Batterskull to control the board and gain incremental advantages. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and card advantage spells like Ancestral Vision and Brainstorm to maintain card advantage and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland allows for resource denial and mana disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to use control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana with mana dorks like Noble Hierarch. The deck aims to tutor for powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf or Progenitus using Natural Order, and also has access to versatile threats like Vendilion Clique. The card draw provided by Brainstorm and Sylvan Library helps ensure consistency in drawing into the deck's key pieces, while cards like Daze and Mental Misstep provide additional disruption to slow down the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to put strong creatures on the board quickly and efficiently, using mana acceleration and tutors to find key pieces. This Aggro-Maverick archetype focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary, Mirran Crusader, and Thrun, the Last Troll, while also having access to versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also utilizes equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance the abilities of its creatures and provide additional threats on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence and putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and equipment. The deck includes powerful card draw and control elements to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional card advantage and control options to help secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Hive Mind and Show and Tell to put Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play. By forcing the opponent to copy spells with Hive Mind, the deck aims to either win the game on the spot or force the opponent to lose by unable to pay for their copies of Pact of the Titan. With a mix of acceleration, card draw, and counter magic, the deck aims to quickly and efficiently execute its game plan to overwhelm and defeat the opponent.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Merfolk creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Coralhelm Commander, Silvergill Adept, and Lord of Atlantis to build a strong board presence. The deck also includes control elements like Cursecatcher, Sower of Temptation, Mental Misstep, Force of Will, and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play and maintain pressure. The deck aims to control the board while continuously applying pressure to ultimately secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Wild Nacatl, Tarmogoyf, and Knight of the Reliquary. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares to control the opponent's board. The inclusion of cards like Noble Hierarch and Green Sun's Zenith allows for mana acceleration and tutoring for key threats. The deck also has some resilience with cards like Punishing Fire and Sylvan Library, providing longevity in longer games. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats to win the game quickly. It utilizes a combination of countermagic, disruption, and aggressive creatures to control the board and pressure the opponent. The key strategy is to stifle the opponent's resources while maximizing the efficiency of its own threats. The deck can grind out longer games with cards like Tarmogoyf and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, or simply overwhelm the opponent with early aggression from cards like Vendilion Clique and Tombstalker.

The deck focuses on utilizing Life from the Loam to repeatedly return lands from the graveyard to hand, creating a steady stream of resources for control. Knight of the Reliquary and Countryside Crusher provide additional land-based synergy, while Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant offer efficient threats and card advantage. Burning Wish allows for versatile access to sideboard cards, while Punishing Fire provides removal and life gain. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through resource denial and incremental advantages, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a combination of threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and board wipes. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage with cards like Ancestral Vision and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes utility lands like Wasteland and Mishra's Factory to keep the opponent's resources in check. By efficiently dealing with threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard mechanics to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Ichorid. By utilizing cards like Careful Study and Breakthrough, along with the Dredge mechanic, this deck is able to quickly fill its graveyard and then utilize cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Narcomoeba and Iona, Shield of Emeria to help control the board and lock down opponents while taking advantage of its graveyard synergies.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently put powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Exhume, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. By utilizing spells like Careful Study and Entomb to fill the graveyard and various counterspells like Force of Will to protect the combo, the deck aims to overpower the opponent with large creatures like Jin-Gitaxias, Iona, and Terastodon. The deck focuses on combining cards to create explosive plays and win games in a quick and decisive manner.
